page.title: 19CLAUGHTON/FARLETON FLOODS
page.content: On August 8th 1967 a freak downpour swept a 30 foot gulley in a tributary of Farleton Beck above Manor House Farm.The beck flooded Brades Farm farm- house and outbuildings and swept a boulder 3 feet in diameter into the farmyard.Claughton Beck was blocked when a tractor and tree branches were trapped under the A683 bridge.This diverted the beck over the lane leading to Claughton Hall,washing away an outbuilding adjoining the barn,2 stout 6 foot gate-posts and the extension on the side of Shaw House Farm.The Fenwick Arms was flooded to a depth of 4 feet and a section of railway line was left suspended in mid-air.Claughton Beck has since been reinforced by a retaining wall at the foot of the lane at Shaw House Farm and flood embankments line the streams as they cross the Lune flood plain.
